revised_title: Mechanism of Prismatic Structure Formation in Basalt
tldr: The author explains the formation of prismatic and jointed structures in basalt through the process of cooling and contraction. The study shows that the hexagonal prism shape is the most efficient form due to the law of least action, and the cup-shaped cross joints are a result of the cooling process. The author also discusses the effects of heterogeneity in the basalt mass and various cooling conditions on the formation of these structures.
